title: What is GATE?
text: The Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) is a national-level exam for admission to postgraduate programs and PSU recruitment. PW offers comprehensive GATE preparation.

title: Complete GATE Syllabus
text: GATE syllabus includes core engineering subjects, engineering mathematics, and general aptitude. PW provides syllabus-aligned study modules.

title: GATE Exam Pattern & Marks
text: The GATE exam includes MCQs and NAT questions. It has a two-hour duration with 65 questions. PW explains marking schemes clearly.

title: Engineering Mathematics for GATE
text: PW's mathematics modules cover linear algebra, calculus, differential equations, and transforms with advanced problem-solving focus.

title: Core Engineering Subject Modules
text: Domain-specific GATE modules include Mechanical, Civil, Electrical, CS, and others, with core-topic lectures and assignments.

title: GATE Previous Year Question Practice
text: PW offers GATE PYQ sets arranged by year, subject, and difficulty, with complete answer keys and in-depth explanations.

title: GATE Mock Test Series
text: Full-length GATE mock tests simulate real exam conditions with performance analytics, rank estimation, and sectional review.

title: Concept Clarity Lectures
text: PW emphasizes building concepts with logical explanations, visuals, and problem-solving strategies tailored for GATE.

title: Time Management Techniques
text: Strategies to allocate time and plan effective revision schedules for GATE preparation, based on past performance reviews.

title: Maintain an Error Log
text: Students are encouraged to track mistakes, analyze root causes, and ensure they do not repeat errors during mock tests.

title: Advanced Problem Sets
text: High-difficulty problem sets for top-rank aspirants, covering trick questions and real GATE Advanced-style problems.

title: GATE Formula Sheets
text: Concise sheets with key formulas for core engineering, mathematics, and general aptitude, useful for quick revision.

title: Practice via PW App
text: Daily quizzes and reinforcement questions for GATE via the PW App help strengthen memory and test-taking ability.

title: Domain Subject Doubt Sessions
text: Interactive sessions focused on core engineering subjects to clarify doubts and reinforce understanding.

title: General Aptitude Prep
text: Modules covering verbal ability and numerical reasoning components for GATE, critical for acing cutoffs.

title: GATE Cut-Off Trends

text: Counseling sessions help students understand PSUs, MSc, MS, and IIT admission pathways based on GATE performance.

text: Advice on what to carry, how to manage stress, time strategy, and approach to tricky problems during the exam.

title: NCERT Foundations for GATE
text: Review crucial NCERT concepts in Physics and Chemistry to ensure a strong foundation for GATE-level questions.

title: Core Calculus Techniques
text: Detailed modules cover differentiation, integration, series expansions, and applications frequently seen in GATE.

text: Modules include matrix operations, eigenvalues, eigenvectors and vector spaces critical for GATE preparation.

text: Comprehensive coverage of core thermodynamics fundamentals for Mechanical and Chemical GATE aspirants.

title: Circuit Theory Fundamentals
text: Basic to advanced circuit theory conceptsâ€”network theorems, transient analysis and frequency response.

text: Key concepts in structural systems, load analysis and stability tailored for Civil GATE aspirants.

title: Fluid Mechanics Essentials
text: Lectures cover fluid properties, flow systems, Bernoulliâ€™s equation and turbulence for engineering students.

title: Digital Logic Design

text: PW modules on chemical thermodynamics, kinetics, and electrochemistry designed for GATE-level rigor.

title: Organic Reaction Mechanisms
text: Conceptual organic chemistry modules cover reaction steps, mechanisms, and retrosynthesis problems.

title: Theory and Proofs in Maths
text: Focus on theorem-proving techniques frequently tested in GATE mathematics questions.

title: Soft Skill Preparation
text: While GATE focuses on technical knowledge, PW offers preparation tips for interviews and PSUs soft skill rounds.

text: Weekly mini-tests focus on single topics across domains to strengthen concept retention and application.

text: Tips to handle numerical answer type (NAT) questionsâ€”approximation techniques and strategic skipping.

text: Techniques to maintain both precision and speedâ€”includes time-saving tricks and error-avoidance tips.

text: Support sessions to manage stress, build positive habits, and maintain consistent momentum during prep.
